Class PlayerDisplay

  • java.lang.Object
    • PlayerDisplay

  • public class PlayerDisplay
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the information that the player sees displayed on the screen.
    Version:
    May 23, 2016
    Author:
    Tejasvi Kothapalli and Andrew Kou, Period: 3, APCS Final Project: LunarX, Sources: None

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayerDisplay

        public PlayerDisplay(Rocket r,
             LunarX l)
        Constructs the PlayerDisplay object. Assigns the rocket and the LunarX game to the fields, and sets the initial point value to 0.
        Parameters:
        r - the rocket the information refers to
        l - the game in which the information is displayed

    • Method Detail

      • showInfo

        public void showInfo(java.awt.Graphics g,
            boolean started)
        Displays the information about the rocket and the player's points. In addition, the showInfo also sets the font and determines whether or not to decrement the fuel count based on if the player is holding down the key for thrust.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics object
        started - the boolean to detect whether the game is in progress or not

      • incrementPoints

        public static void incrementPoints(int x)
        Increments the player's points by the given value.
        Parameters:
        x - the value to increment the points by

      • showMenu

            int w,
            int h)
        Displays the start menu on the screen.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics object
